books.title: Wraith in the Shell
books.series: Book One of the Iron Chronicle
books.description: Mankind serves a new apex predator: the off-world invaders called Wraiths. Even with the invention of Shells, a highly versatile machine of war, they lost. Many years later, a man who pilots one of these Shells ends up becoming one in an accident.

books.title: Slipstream
books.description: All he desired was speed -- the speed to win. "Black Crow" his moniker, the desire was insatiable. When the underground racing scene suddenly chose him to participate in its greatest event, however, he discovers it will take much more than speed to win this time around. Namely, a team.

books.title: March of the Wicked Ones
books.description: The Ashen War still rages, even after a hundred years. Warriors with bodies of ash and hearts of ember roam like drones, spreading ever-blackening the lands in soot. Why or how, no one exactly knows, only that they wish to conquer the world. The key to the answer lies in a young boy's nightmare: a vision of a capital crumbling to dust.

books.title: Garden in the Rough
books.description: Richard was a nobody -- just another blue collar worker. To others, at least. In truth, he was a gardener, at home with the things of green. While alone, he spends his time reviving an old, abandoned atrium from a time before the city bloomed to life. To his surprise, he discovers that the wooden archway in the back is more in touch with the past than it first seems.

books.title: West of the Rising Sun
books.description: It has been a hundred years since the countries of Europa and the Land of the Rising Sun, or Japan, met each other for the first time. The war for the Middle, the location of their first meeting and a place immense resources, continues to this day. The seeds of to bringing about peace are sown the day a rebel to Japan's militaristic regime, the New Sun, is banished to the West, where a chance encounter with its deadliest outlaw takes place.

books.title: Breathe
books.description: Sara Yamaguchi is a high-school student transferring to Iwara East High, and has a knack for noticing things -- body language, bird species, or the local convienience store employee changing shifts, you name it. The only thing unnatural about it is when she notices the classroom recluse vanishing into thin air.

books.title: Horizon Down
books.series: Spin-off novella from the Iron Chronicle
books.description: It is empty when the prisoners awake, the few that do. Empty, as there are no wardens in the prison, no guards, and the electronic barriers are off. Some prisoners take this as an opportunity to escape, but others find evidence that someone -- or something -- sabotaged the station. New Horizon Prison, stationed at Langrange 1 between the Earth and Moon, has gone dark.

books.title: Another Day in Retail
books.description: A retail employee, fed up with his mediocre position, joins the 'bust' team, responsible for tracking down petty store thieves with local authorities. Little did he know that busting an unassuming pawn shop would place him in the crosshairs of a long running crime syndicate -- and they do not take kindly to bad business.

books.title: JÃ¤ger
books.description: While investigating the case of a doctor who died after reading a strange letter, strait-laced detective Arthur Daw and his roguish partner Valentine Descartes must unravel a thread connecting seemingly unconnected people -- before the last letter is sent.

books.title: Prismyriad
books.description: The Great Impact -- the day a meteor of unknown origin struck the Earth. Contained inside was an alien disease that crystallizes organic life as it consumes it. In an effort to find a cure, prominent subjects are captured by a militarized CDC to observe this "Crystallization". One of these, subject name 'Prismarine', develops the ability to experience the memories of those also afflicted by Crystallization.
